result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Rabe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert W Rabe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert W Rabe was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber granted
Report clean and sober

Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Fines/costs to be paid within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Furlough Request approved s/BNB/5-30-2017
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
of Right to Attorney

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to move forward with the plea.    Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 2 to Misd. Battery 940.19(1), Class A Misd.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.
Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.     Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Court will amend Ct. 2 of the information to Misd. Battery 940.19(1), Class A Misd as requested by the State.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 2:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before May 5, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 1 day
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Pay within 60 days

Ct. 2 to be dismissed
Plea hearing on April 20, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Final pre-trial on March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on April 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is not resolved and asks that it be set for trial.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has spoke to an Attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on November 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Return date on December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the last time in court the defendant did want to get new counsel.  Defendant would like to proceed without counsel.  Defendant does not want to accept the offer.  Court questions the defendant.  Atty Hendee states that he did speak with Atty Bolles regarding an offer; however, he has not spoke with the defendant directly.  Atty Hendee suggests a pre-trial be set.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set for return and pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Order Granting Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
s/BNB 09-22-16
Return date on November 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney David Andrew Bolles appeared by phone means for Defendant Robert W Rabe. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.
Court questions Atty Bolles.  Atty Bolles asks to withdraw from the case.  Defendant agrees with the withdrawal.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will approve Atty Bolles to withdraw.
Atty Bolles will prepare an order.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on September 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did have a pre-trial with Atty Bolles.  Atty Bolles agrees and asks for one reset on the matter; there will most likely be resolution to the matter.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Bolles; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Bolles agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Bolles states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Discovery has been provided however, the parties are requesting a reset.
Atty Bolles agree.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
STATEMENT OF COMPLIANCE
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.  
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No violent or abusive contact with Rebecca Fenne

Court questions the defendant. Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim; time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert W Rabe in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
